tweet: It is important for Arkansans to stay home if possible as we work to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. When it is necessary to be out of the home, be mindful in public spaces. Keep a safe distance of at least six feet from others. There is no need for crowding.

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson
tweet: In order for us to be successful in Arkansas in slowing the upward trend line of COVID-19, the public needs to abide by the guidance of the Arkansas Department of Health. @ADHPIO guidelines and directives can be found here:  https://t.co/tFzZuRkedi

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson
tweet: I am grateful for our federal delegation’s communication & support they’ve given the state, especially through the passage of the COVID-19 relief bill by the Senate. This bill provides confidence to Arkansans whose employment or small business has been affected by the outbreak.

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson
tweet: Social distancing does not have to mean staying in the home, although this is an effective way to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. Walking, hiking, fishing, and other outdoor activities are all consistent with social distancing practices.

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson
tweet: (1/4) Yesterday I announced the first presumptive positive case of COVID-19 in Arkansas. I learned today that we now have five additional presumptive positive cases in our state. This is not uncommon. We have seen the spread progress in a similar fashion in other states.

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson
tweet: (2/2) For months, AR has been preparing to respond to COVID-19. We're taking measures to mitigate the spread of the virus. Practice healthy habits, wash your hands frequently, & stay home if you're not feeling well. Beyond that, continue to conduct business & normal activities.

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson
tweet: (5/5) We take this COVID-19 outbreak seriously & are taking precautions. But I'm keeping my normal schedule & we should continue to do business; go to school & enjoy a beautiful spring.

name: Gov. Asa Hutchinson
tweet: (2/5) As of today, there are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the state. We are currently monitoring 100 travelers with daily @ADHPIO check-in & guidance. There have been 12 negative test results & our state lab is equipped to do testing in house.
